questions.question_text: What is an example of a reconnaissance attack tool that will cycle through all well-known ports to provide a complete list of all services that are running on the hosts?

discussion.content: Real hackers don't need nmap and go straight to show run.

comments.content: if someone has access to SHOW RUN why would that person want to do any discovery work? NMAP is correct and clear no matter what kind of PRO someone is

discussion.content: For more on answer D, see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/OpenVAS

questions.question_text: Which two are software vulnerability scanners? (Choose two.)

discussion.content: I always thought it was answer A

questions.question_text: What best describes an amplification attack?

choices.B: A small forged packet elicits a large reply from the reflectors.
choices.C: A small radio signal is initially weak and eventually increases the signal strength so that wireless devices will attach to it instead of the legitimate AP.
choices.A: A low volume of bad music is played progressively louder to the point that it becomes unbearable for people to listen to it.
choices.D: There is no such attack that is called an amplification attack.

discussion.content: I thought I was a professional until I saw D was not correct

questions.question_text: What best describes a DoS attack?

choices.B: poses as legitimate software or email attachment in order to launch a malicious attack when opened
choices.A: attempts to consume all of a critical computer or network resource in order to make it unavailable for valid use
choices.D: rarely seen because DoS attacks are extremely difficult to engineer and almost impossible to deliver
choices.C: can steal data such as user names and passwords without the user realizing that they have been compromised

discussion.content: Wait, so MAC spoofing does not change your IP?

questions.question_text: What type of spoofing attack uses fake source IP addresses that are different than their real IP addresses?
